title: Watch Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition As Trains Honk In Synchrony - News18
summary:
Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, News18

The iconic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST) station in Mumbai echoed with a symphony of train horns as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve, marking a unique tradition that has become synonymous with the station.

  • The tradition involves rail car sheds and locomotives simultaneously honking at midnight on New Year's Eve.
  • Commuters captured and shared the event on social media, with some users expressing surprise at the tradition while others noted its commonality.
  • Railway enthusiasts are credited with coordinating this event for several years, turning it into an eagerly awaited spectacle.
  • The atmosphere at the station on New Year's Eve is charged with joy and camaraderie, bringing people from all walks of life together to celebrate the railway heritage.
newTitle: Mumbai Station's Unique New Year Tradition: Trains Honk in Synchrony

title: Cabinet approves extension of One-time Special Package on Di-Ammonium Phosphate (DAP) beyond the NBS subsidy for the period from 01.01.2025 till further orders to ensure sustainable availability of DAP at affordable prices to the farmers - PIB
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him' - News18
summary:
Delhi Bakery Owner Dies By Suicide Amid Divorce Dispute, Family Says 'Wife Mentally Tortured Him'

Date & Source: January 01, 2025, 19:50 IST - News18

Puneet Khurana, owner of For God’s Cake bakery, allegedly died by suicide amid an ongoing divorce dispute with his wife. He was found hanging in his house in Model Town’s Kalyan Vihar area. His family claimed that Puneet was "upset with his wife" and had been facing mental torture and harassment from her and her family.

Key Points:

  1. The couple got married in 2016 and co-owned the bakery and another eatery called Woodbox Cafe.
  2. Puneet's last conversation was with his wife, discussing their bakery business. His family claims the wife recorded the conversation and sent it to her relatives.
  3. Puneet's sister accused his wife and her family of mental torture and harassment, with a 59-minute video recording as evidence.
  4. The case comes weeks after a similar incident involving a Bengaluru-based techie.

Notable Quote:

"You are calling me at 3 am, can’t you sleep? You disrespected me and my family." - Puneet Khurana's wife, as per India Today

Conclusion: The incident has once again highlighted the issue of mental harassment and torture within marriages, with calls for stricter laws and better support systems for victims.
newTitle: Delhi Bakery Owner's Suicide Linked to Divorce Dispute and Alleged Harassment

title: Woman tries to kill 21-year-old friend in Noida for refusing to marry her - The Times of India
summary:
Violent Incident in Noida: Woman Attacks Friend Over Marriage Refusal

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a shocking incident in Noida, a 21-year-old woman allegedly attempted to kill her friend after he refused her marriage proposal. The case has raised concerns about the extreme reactions to relationship rejections.

  • A woman in Noida tried to kill her friend.
  • The incident occurred after the friend refused to marry her.
  • The attack has sparked discussions on societal pressures regarding marriage.
“This incident highlights the extreme consequences of societal and relational pressures.”

This incident serves as a grave reminder of the societal challenges related to relationships and the potential for violence in response to rejection.
newTitle: Violent Incident in Noida: Woman Attacks Friend Over Marriage Refusal

title: Lucknow: Agra man shoots chilling video after killing mother, 4 sisters at hotel, explains reason behind murders - Hindustan Times
summary:
Lucknow Tragedy: Man Kills Mother and Four Sisters, Claims to Protect Family

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Hindustan Times

Lucknow woke up to a horrifying incident where a 24-year-old man, Arshad, allegedly murdered his mother and four sisters at a hotel, claiming he acted to "protect" his family from neighbors who planned to sell his sisters in Hyderabad.

  1. The family, originally from Agra, had been staying at the hotel since December 30 to celebrate New Year.
  2. Arshad served his family food and alcohol laced with intoxicants before killing them.
  3. Arshad recorded a video after the crime, explaining his actions and showing the bodies.
  4. Police have detained Arshad, and his father remains at large.

"Our neighbours were trying to take over our property and planned to sell my sisters in Hyderabad. I couldn’t let that happen," Arshad purportedly said in the video.

Police are reviewing CCTV camera footage to trace Arshad’s father and bring him to justice.
newTitle: Lucknow Tragedy: Man Kills Mother and Four Sisters, Claims to Protect Family

'Gave alcohol, slit their wrists': Man kills mother, 4 sisters in Lucknow hotel; father aided murders - The Times of India
summary:
‘Gave alcohol, slit their wrists’: Man kills mother, 4 sisters in Lucknow hotel; father aided murders

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

In a horrific incident, a man allegedly killed his mother and four sisters in a Lucknow hotel, with his father accused of aiding in the murders. The case has drawn significant media attention and public outrage.

  • The accused reportedly gave alcohol to the victims before committing the murders.
  • Police have launched a full investigation into the case, which has shocked the local community.
  • Authorities are examining the family's background and potential motives behind the crime.
“It’s an unimaginable tragedy,” said a local community leader, expressing outrage over the incident.

This brutal act underscores the need for greater attention to mental health and domestic violence issues in society.
newTitle: Tragic Family Murder in Lucknow Hotel: A Shocking Crime

title: Bengaluru suicide case: HC tells techie's dad to inform SC about daughter-in-law's custody - The Federal
summary:
Bengaluru suicide case: HC tells techie's dad to inform SC about daughter-in-law's custody

Date: January 1, 2023

Source: PTI

The Karnataka High Court has instructed the father of Atul Subhash, a techie who committed suicide, to notify the Supreme Court regarding the judicial custody status of Nikita, his estranged wife and the accused.

  • The Supreme Court is reviewing a petition by Atul's mother seeking custody of her minor grandson.
  • Justice Hemant Chandangoudar issued the interim order following a challenge by Nikita against her arrest.
  • Nikita's legal counsel argued her arrest was illegal, citing improper grounds for detention.
  • The State Public Prosecutor requested additional time to compile investigation details.
  • The High Court agreed to expedite consideration of Nikita's bail plea, scheduled for January 4.
Nikita’s lawyer highlighted the unlawful nature of her arrest, emphasizing her imperative to defend herself.

The situation surrounding the case highlights critical legal questions and the ongoing family dispute over the custody of the child.
newTitle: High Court Directs Techie's Father on Daughter-in-Law's Custody Amid Ongoing Case

title: Bharat Ratna Demand For Manmohan Singh Gains Momentum After Telangana Assembly Resolution - News18
summary:
Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: News18

The Telangana Assembly has urged the Central government to confer the Bharat Ratna on former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, prompting many in Congress to support the initiative. Congress leaders are calling for the highest civilian award to honor his significant contributions.

  • Telangana Assembly passes a resolution demanding Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh.
  • Congress Deputy Leader in the Rajya Sabha, Pramod Tiwari, emphasizes the need to acknowledge Singh's leadership.
  • Subharansh Kumar Rai mentions Singh's advocacy for key legislation such as the Right to Education and Right to Information.
  • BJP criticizes Congress for not acting on a previous recommendation to award Singh the Bharat Ratna.
  • Manmohan Singh recently passed away at the age of 92.
“I urge the Centre to accept the resolution. Manmohanji was a great leader of our country and he should be awarded the Bharat Ratna.” - Pramod Tiwari

The push for the Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh highlights his acknowledged role in shaping modern India, suggesting a broader recognition of his legacy may be underway.
newTitle: Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution

Tamil Nadu govt cancels smart meter tender awarded to Adani Energy Solutions - The Economic Times
summary:
Tamil Nadu Cancels Smart Meter Tender Awarded to Adani Energy Solutions

Published on: Jan 01, 2025, Source: PTI

The Tamil Nadu government has cancelled a global tender for smart meters, citing the high costs quoted by Adani Energy Solutions Ltd. This decision follows serious allegations against the Adani Group regarding a USD 250 million bribery scheme for solar contracts.

  • The Tamil Nadu Power Distribution Corporation cancelled smart meter tenders due to high costs.
  • Adani Energy Solutions was the lowest bidder but quoted higher prices than expected.
  • The cancellation occurred on December 27, 2024.
  • A re-tender for procuring smart meters is likely to occur soon.
  • Allegations against Gautam Adani involve a USD 250 million bribery scheme, which the company denies.
"The company has refuted the allegations."

The cancellation of the tender raises questions regarding procurement practices and the impact on smart meter implementation in Tamil Nadu.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Cancels Smart Meter Tender Awarded to Adani Energy Solutions

'Openly distributing money': Arvind Kejriwal writes to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, asks whether it supports - The Times of India
summary:
Kejriwal Questions RSS's Allegiance to BJP in a Letter

Publication Date: Not specified in the article
Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has written an open letter to RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat questioning whether the RSS supports the BJP's policies. This letter seeks clarity on the RSS's stance amid ongoing political tensions.

  • Kejriwal's letter addresses the collaboration between RSS and BJP.
  • He highlights the need for clarity on RSS's support for the BJP.
  • The letter raises concerns regarding the political implications of such support.
"We need to understand the RSS's position in the current political landscape."

This letter marks a notable attempt by Kejriwal to publicly challenge the RSS's influence in Indian politics.

title: Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law [Marriage, Divorce, Child Custody, Alimony & Succession] - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law [Marriage, Divorce, Child Custody, Alimony & Succession]

Date & Source: 2024 LiveLaw

This article provides an overview of significant rulings by the Supreme Court in the area of family law, focusing on issues related to child custody, divorce, maintenance, and succession. Key judgements address parental alienation, the welfare of children, and guidelines for determining alimony.

  • Custody disputes should carefully evaluate claims of parental alienation.
  • Minor children's welfare encompasses their physical, educational, and social needs.
  • The right to maintenance should ensure a decent standard of living for spouses post-divorce.
  • New interpretations regarding the legitimacy of children from void marriages and their inheritance rights.
  • There are strict guidelines on how custody and guardianship must be approached in court.
“The interest of the minor child is paramount...” - Supreme Court ruling on visitation rights.

This summary encapsulates the crucial judicial perspectives on family law offered by the Supreme Court, emphasizing children's welfare, equitable treatment in divorce, and the adherence to legal provisions concerning marriage and property rights.
newTitle: Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law Highlights

‘Happy 2025’: PM Modi extends New Year greetings to the nation | Today News - Mint
summary:
‘Happy 2025’: PM Modi extends New Year greetings to the nation

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed his New Year wishes for 2025, hoping for success and happiness for everyone. He shared his message on social media, highlighting the importance of health and prosperity in the new year.

Happy 2025! May this year bring everyone new opportunities, success and endless joy. May everybody be blessed with wonderful health and prosperity.— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 1, 2025

Celebrations across India filled the streets as people welcomed the new year with joy, parties, and prayers.

President Murmu among other leaders extend New Year greetings

Other leaders, including President Droupadi Murmu and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, also shared their New Year wishes, focusing on themes of harmony and inclusivity.

Wishing everyone a very Happy New Year! May the year 2025 bring joy, harmony and prosperity to all!
Wishing everyone a very Happy New Year! I hope this year brings new enthusiasm, joy, and happiness to your life.

Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis also shared his optimistic New Year message, encouraging hope and determination.

Heartiest, healthiest and happiest wishes to everyone! As we step into 2025... Happy2025!

Conclusion

The New Year ushered in an optimistic spirit among leaders and citizens alike, with shared hopes for a prosperous year ahead.
newTitle: PM Modi Wishes Nation a Happy 2025

title: 'No shortcuts': Tracing delivery boy-turned-civil judge Muhammed Yaseen's journey to success - ThePrint
summary:
From Delivery Boy to Civil Judge: The Inspiring Journey of Muhammed Yaseen

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: ThePrint

Muhammed Yaseen, a former delivery boy turned civil judge, shares his remarkable journey overcoming obstacles with the help of mentors and personal determination.

  • Yaseen was born in Pattambi, Kerala, and started his education in a Malayalam-medium school.
  • He worked various odd jobs, including as a milk supplier and delivery person, to support his family.
  • Yaseen pursued higher education with a BA in Public Administration and earned an LLB.
  • With the support of colleagues and mentors, he became a motivation for aspiring judges.
  • He secured the second rank in the Kerala Judicial Services exam, emphasizing hard work over shortcuts.
  • Yaseen faced challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic, which limited job opportunities but did not deter his resolve.
“There are no shortcuts or tricks to success. Ultimately only one’s hard work and effort make all the difference.” - Muhammed Yaseen

Yaseen’s story is a testament to perseverance, inspiring many aspiring legal professionals to believe in themselves and strive for their dreams.
newTitle: From Delivery Boy to Civil Judge: The Inspiring Journey of Muhammed Yaseen

title: PM Modi greets India on New Year - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi greets India on New Year

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Extending his greetings to the nation on the New Year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on January 1, 2025, expressed his hopes for new opportunities, success, and endless joy.

  • Modi wished for the year to bring health and prosperity for all.
  • President Droupadi Murmu also extended New Year greetings, urging collaboration for a brighter future.
  • Both leaders expressed hope for inclusiveness and sustainability in the New Year.
“Happy 2025! May this year bring everyone new opportunities, success and endless joy.” - PM Modi
“May the year 2025 bring joy, harmony and prosperity to all!” - President Droupadi Murmu

This New Year marks a time for reflection and hope, with leaders calling for unity and progress in the upcoming year.

title: Five family members murdered in Lucknow hotel, accused held - The Indian Express
summary:
Family of Five Found Dead in Lucknow Hotel

Lucknow, India - January 2025 - Five members of a family from Agra were found dead inside a hotel room in Lucknow city’s Naka area on Wednesday, according to the Uttar Pradesh Police.

The deceased include a 49-year-old woman, Asman, and her four daughters – Alishiya (19), Rehmeen (18), Aksha (16), and Aliya (9).

The police have detained Asman’s son, Arshad (24), who reportedly confessed to killing his mother and sisters over a family dispute.

The bodies have been sent for postmortem, and some of the victims had injury marks on their wrists. The police are investigating the cause of death and checking CCTV footage at the hotel.

The police received information about the bodies in the hotel room on Wednesday morning.
newTitle: Family of Five Found Dead in Lucknow Hotel: Mother and Four Daughters Killed by Son

title: Manipur witnesses fresh violence on first day of 2025 in Imphal West - India Today NE
summary:
Manipur witnesses fresh violence on first day of 2025 in Imphal West

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Living Media India Limited

Violence struck Manipur's Kadangband area on New Year's Day as suspected militants attacked from Kangpokpi district.

  • The attack occurred around 1 am, with militants firing rounds and hurling bombs.
  • Village volunteers returned fire while additional security forces were deployed.
  • Despite the gunfire, no injuries were reported.
  • Many villagers fled their homes seeking safety.
  • This attack marks a continuation of violence in the region since May 2023.
"No injuries were reported in the firing, the police said."

The violence on New Year's Day continues a troubling trend in Manipur, raising concerns over security and safety in the region.
newTitle: Manipur Experiences New Year's Day Violence as Militant Attacks Erupt
